name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, remove 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pok√©mon. This power can't be used if Vileplume is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. Vileplume is now Confused (after doing damage).

flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

strengths: Petal Dance can deal up to 120 damage
Grass type is effective against Water Pokemon
weaknesses: 80 HP is low for a Stage 2
Petal Dance confuses Vileplume after use
synergies: Scoop Up - pick up Confused Vileplume
counters: Fire Pokemon - double damage from weakness
Consistent attackers - Vileplume's damage is unreliable

competitiveHistory: Vileplume from Jungle was not competitively viable due to its self-inflicted Confusion from Petal Dance. While the potential for 120 damage was exciting, the coin-flip nature and guaranteed Confusion made it too unreliable for tournament play. The Heal Pokemon Power was a nice bonus but also coin-dependent. Players preferred more consistent options, and this Vileplume was largely outclassed. Note that this is different from Dark Vileplume (Team Rocket) which had a much more impactful Trainer-locking power.

rulings.ruling: Vileplume becomes Confused after dealing damage, not before. The damage is calculated and applied first.
If you flip 0 heads on Petal Dance, it does 0 damage but Vileplume still becomes Confused.
Heal can target any of your Pokemon, including Vileplume itself.
Heal removes 1 damage counter (10 damage), not 1 damage.
